Description: Textile; mummy padding; approximately oval pad of bunched and folded linen, undyed, but now buff to brown-black in colour (oily stains ?). Part of a triple self-band on underneath. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.23 ends per 10mm and weft c.12 picks per 10mm.
Production date: 600 BC (circa - if from Dr. Granville's mummy)
Condition: Poor; very dirty and brittle. Insect damage.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville (by inference)
Acquisition notes: One of eight pads of cloth (EA 76007-76014), found together in a bundle and labelled in a 19th century hand as 'Mummy Compresses'. Wrapper and handwriting as those which accompanied other mummy wrappings from Dr A B Granville. These pieces are probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by Granville in 1821.
